BayesFlare

Models¶

The Flare Models¶

class bayesflare.models.flare.Flare(ts, amp=1, t0=None, reverse=False)[source]¶

Creates an exponentially decaying flare model with a Gaussian rise.

Parameters:

amp : float, optional

The amplitude of the flare. Defaults to 1.

ts : ndarray

A vector containing time stamps.

t0 : float, optional

The time of peak. Defaults to the centre of ts.

reverse : bool, optional

A boolean flag. Set this to reverse the flare shape.
Returns:

f : ndarray

An array containing the flare model.

Methods

filter_model(m[, nbins, order]) Use the Savitzky-Golay smoothing to high-pass filter the model m:
identity_string() Returns a string which identifies the model.
identity_type() Returns the type of model represented by the object.
model(amp, tauGauss, tauExp, t0, ts) Private method to generate the flare time series.
modeldict(pdict, ts) A method to generate a model given a time vector and a dictionary of model parameters.
output_model(i, j[, ts, filt, nbins, order]) A private class to return a model from the object.
parameters_refresh() Refreshes the object to reflect new parameters set by set_taus_exp and set_taus_gauss.
set_taus_exp(low[, high, number]) Allows the tau_exp parameter of the model to be set.
set_taus_gauss(low[, high, number]) Allows the tau_gauss parameter of the model to be set.
update_priors() Updates the priors to reflect the models.
filter_model(m, nbins=101, order=3)[source]¶

Use the Savitzky-Golay smoothing to high-pass filter the model m:

Parameters:

m : ndarray

An array containing the model.

nbins : int, optional

An odd integer width (in bins) for the filtering.

order : int, optional

The polynomial order for the filtering.
identity_string()[source]¶

Returns a string which identifies the model.

Returns:

str :

A string identifying the model and its parameters.
identity_type()[source]¶

Returns the type of model represented by the object.

Returns:

str :

A string containing the type of the model the object represents.
model(amp, tauGauss, tauExp, t0, ts)[source]¶

Private method to generate the flare time series.

modeldict(pdict, ts)[source]¶

A method to generate a model given a time vector and a dictionary of model parameters.

Parameters:

pdict : dictionary of parameters

A dictionary containing the parameters of the desired model output. The valid names for the parameters are contained within flare.paramnames
output_model(i, j, ts=None, filt=False, nbins=101, order=3)[source]¶

A private class to return a model from the object. Should be used with the __call__ process.

Parameters:

i, j : int

The locations in the tau_gauss and tau_exp arrays.

ts : ndarray, optional

The time axis to generate the model on. Defaults to the normal object’s normal time axis.

filt : bool, optional

Boolean flag to enable filtering on the output model. Defaults to False.

nbins : int, optional

The width, in bins, of the filter. Defaults to 101.

order : int, optional

The order of the filter.
parameters_refresh()[source]¶

Refreshes the object to reflect new parameters set by set_taus_exp and set_taus_gauss.

set_taus_exp(low, high=None, number=None)[source]¶

Allows the tau_exp parameter of the model to be set.

Parameters:

low : float

The lowest value of tau_exp to be used.

high : float, optional

The highest value of tau_exp to be used.

number : int, optional

The number of intervals to be created between the low and high values of tau_exp.
set_taus_gauss(low, high=None, number=None)[source]¶

Allows the tau_gauss parameter of the model to be set.

Parameters:

low : float

The lowest value of tau_gauss to be used.

high : float, optional

The highest value of tau_gauss to be used.

number : int, optional

The number of intervals to be created between the low and high values of tau_gauss.
update_priors()[source]¶

Updates the priors to reflect the models.

class bayesflare.models.expdecay.Expdecay(ts, amp=1, t0=None, reverse=False)[source]¶

Creates an exponentially decaying flare model with a sudden rise.

Parameters:

amp : float, optional

The amplitude of the flare. Defaults to 1.

ts : ndarray

A vector containing time stamps.

t0 : float, optional

The time of peak. Defaults to the centre of ts.

reverse : bool, optional

A boolean flag. Set this to reverse the flare shape.
Returns:

f : ndarray

An array containing the flare model.

Methods

A private class to return a model from the object. Should be used with the __call__ process.

i, j : int

The locations in the tau_exp array.

The time axis to generate the model on. Defaults to the normal object’s normal time axis.

filt : bool, optional

Boolean flag to enable filtering on the output model. Defaults to False.

nbins : int, optional

The width, in bins, of the filter. Defaults to 101.

order : int, optional

The order of the filter.

high : float, optional

The highest value of tau_exp to be used.

number : int, optional

The number of intervals to be created between the low and high values of tau_exp.

Updates the priors to reflect the models.

The Transit Models¶

class bayesflare.models.transit.Transit(ts, amp=1, t0=None)[source]¶

A transit model with a half-Gaussian dip and rise and flat bottom profile.

Parameters:

amp : float, optional

The amplitude of the flare. Defaults to 1.

ts : ndarray

A vector containing time stamps.

t0 : float, optional

The time of peak. Defaults to the centre of ts.
Returns:

f : ndarray

An array containing the transit model.

Methods

filter_model(m[, nbins, order]) Use the Savitzky-Golay smoothing to high-pass filter the model m:
identity_string() Returns a string which identifies the model.
identity_type() Returns the type of model represented by the object.
model(amp, sigmag, tauf, t0, ts) Private method to generate the impulse time series.
modeldict(pdict, ts) A method to generate a model given a time vector and a dictionary of model parameters.
output_model(i, j[, ts, filt, nbins, order]) A private class to return a model from the object.
parameters_refresh() Refreshes the object to reflect new parameters set by set_taus_exp and set_taus_gauss.
set_maxduration(maxd) Sets the maxdur parameter.
set_sigmag(low[, high, number]) Allows the sigmag parameter of the model to be set.
set_tauf(low[, high, number]) Allows the tauf parameter of the model to be set.
update_priors([sigmagcutoff]) Updates the priors to reflect the models.

An array containing the model.

nbins : int, optional

An odd integer width (in bins) for the filtering.

order : int, optional

The polynomial order for the filtering.

output_model(i, j, ts=None, filt=False, nbins=101, order=3)[source]¶

A private class to return a model from the object. Should be used with the __call__ process.

Parameters:

i,j : int

The locations in the sigmag and tauf arrays.

ts : ndarray, optional

The time axis to generate the model on. Defaults to the normal object’s normal time axis.

filt : bool, optional

Boolean flag to enable filtering on the output model. Defaults to False.

nbins : int, optional

The width, in bins, of the filter. Defaults to 101.

order : int, optional

The order of the filter.
parameters_refresh()[source]¶

Refreshes the object to reflect new parameters set by set_taus_exp and set_taus_gauss.

set_maxduration(maxd)[source]¶

Sets the maxdur parameter.

Parameters:

maxd : float

The maximum duration, in hours.
set_sigmag(low, high=None, number=None)[source]¶

Allows the sigmag parameter of the model to be set.

Parameters:

low : float

The lowest value of sigmag to be used.

high : float, optional

The highest value of sigmag to be used.

number : int, optional

The number of intervals to be created between the low and high values of sigmag.
set_tauf(low, high=None, number=None)[source]¶

Allows the tauf parameter of the model to be set.

Parameters:

low : float

The lowest value of tauf to be used.

high : float, optional

The highest value of tauf to be used.

number : int, optional

The number of intervals to be created between the low and high values of tauf.
update_priors(sigmagcutoff=2)[source]¶

Updates the priors to reflect the models.
